results.title: Birds of the Sun God. In Flight Movie
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wildlife on One”.
Two films narrated by David Attenborough from the BBC Wildlife on one series. “Birds of the Sun God” tells the fascinating story of the partnership between hummingbirds and plants, a partnership which has lasted three million years. “In Flight Movie” uses remarkable new filming techniques to enable us to take to the air ourselves. This unique film enables you to fly in the clouds with a flock of geese, look over the shoulder of a soaring buzzard or hedge hop with a speeding starling, revealing just how a bird’s design is shaped to the life it leads - in flight! Issued as a BBC wildlife special.

results.title: Camel
results.creator_credit: John Shaw, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wildlife Australia”.
A study of the history of the camel in Australia and the way the animal has adapted to the environment. Corrects some of the popular misconceptions about the camel and its habitat and shows people who work with them in the outback. Two other introduced species - horses and donkeys - are also mentioned.

results.title: River red gum
results.creator_credit: Dione Gilmour, Michael Vance, Victoria. Ministry for Conservation and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wildlife Australia”.
Shows the river red gum in its natural habitat, sheltering caterpillars, tiny marsupial carnivores, mistletoe birds, spitfires and saw flies. Also contains unique footage of ants farming slow-witted caterpillars for their sweet sticky secretions, in a three way business arrangement with the tree.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dione Gilmour, Michael Vance, Victoria. Ministry for Conservation and ABC-TV (Australia)

results.title: Creek and billabong
results.creator_credit: Dione Gilmour, Michael Vance and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wildlife Australia”.
Observes insect, bird and animal life around creeks and billabongs-the metamorphosis of a grublike mudeye into a dragonfly, yabbies, a kingfisher begging a meal from another kingfisher, a caddis fly building itself a sort of flying fortress to swim about in - and explains with superb close-ups, why wrigglers wriggle. The interrelationship of creatures living in these two aquatic environments, and the food chains of animal life found in freshwater are shown. Depicts the metamorphosis of the dragon-fly and the mosquito and looks at the caddis-fly, yappy, platypus, Murray cod and the water-rat.

results.title: Dare the wildest river
results.brief_description:

Conveys the adventure and excitement of a Colorado River rapids trip through the Grand Canyon.

results.title: Secret world: around the bay
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wild Life Australia”.
There is life in Port Phillip Bay. Fascinating close-up photography demonstrates sea-creatures breathing, eating, propelling themselves and watching each other. Also shows some of the techniques of underwater exploration and some of the laboratory techniques of observing and classifying newly discovered life-forms.
